properties.areaDesc: Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu; Manua
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 1:59AM SBT by NWS Pago Pago AS
properties.description:
A monsoonal trough will remain centered over the American Samoa
coastal waters this week. Marine observations and model data show
sustained winds around 35 knots, with higher gusts, continuing
within the coastal waters through mid week.

Additionally, tropical cyclone Sarai's influence over the
American Samoa coastal waters, will continue to slowly diminish
through Wednesday morning.

Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions. It is highly recommended that
mariners without the proper experience to seek safe harbor prior
to the onset of gale conditions.

Listen to NOAA Weather Radio for the latest updates. You may also
follow us on Facebook "NWSPagoPago" or our website at
www.weather.gov/ppg.

NWSheadline: A Gale Warning continues for the American Samoan coastal waters through Wednesday
